intro: Zanthoxylum kibada, commonly known as African prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it valuable in herbal remedies. Zanthoxylum kibada thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
